tool_description: The most granular real time financial sentiment API in the world.
name: PsychSignal
title: PsychSignal

api_list.name: GET /api/sentiments/all
api_list.description: Returns the raw bullish and bearish values for all stocks and specific date aggregated by period. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level.

required_parameters.name: period
required_parameters.description: Period of sentiments aggregation. It can be d for daily values or 2 for 2 minutes values. (Required)

optional_parameters.name: date
optional_parameters.description: Specific date of the request. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Date can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

api_list.name: GET /api/alerts-stream
api_list.description: Returns paginated alerts triggered on the system from most recent to oldest. It can be stock specific and it is limited to 100 alerts per request. It's also limited by your API level access.

optional_parameters.name: max_id
optional_parameters.description: Alert ID. Alerts returned will be older than the specified id. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Number of alerts to be returned. Max and default to 100 alerts. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: symbol
optional_parameters.description: Stock symbol. Examples: AAPL, IBM, FB. For the aggregate of all market sentiment, use MARKET as symbol. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

api_list.name: GET /api/ratio
api_list.description: Returns daily bullish / bearish messages volume ratio for a specific symbol. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level.

optional_parameters.name: symbol
optional_parameters.description: Stock symbol. Examples: AAPL, IBM, FB. For the aggregate of all market sentiment, use MARKET as symbol. Defaults to MARKET. (optional)

optional_parameters.name: from
optional_parameters.description: Start date of the returned range. The date must be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: to
optional_parameters.description: End date of the returned range. The date must be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

api_list.name: GET /api/ratio/all
api_list.description: Returns daily bullish / bearish messages volume ratio for all symbols. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level.

optional_parameters.name: date
optional_parameters.description: Specific date of the request. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Date can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

api_list.name: GET /api/sentiments
api_list.description: Returns the raw bullish and bearish values for a specific stock and specified date range aggregated by period. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level.

required_parameters.name: symbol
required_parameters.description: Stock symbol. Examples: AAPL, IBM, FB. For the aggregate of all market sentiment, use MARKET as symbol. (Required)

required_parameters.name: period
required_parameters.description: Period of sentiments aggregation. It can be d for daily values or 2 for 2 minutes values. (Required)

optional_parameters.name: from
optional_parameters.description: Start date of the returned range. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: to
optional_parameters.description: End date of the returned range. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

api_list.name: GET /api/alerts
api_list.description: Returns alerts triggered on the system for the requested date range. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level. It can be stock specific and the date range is limited to 30 days.

optional_parameters.name: from
optional_parameters.description: Start date of the returned range. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: to
optional_parameters.description: End date of the returned range. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: symbol
optional_parameters.description: Stock symbol. Examples: AAPL, IBM, FB. For the aggregate of all market sentiment, use MARKET as symbol. (Optional)

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)
